intro: Enterosora torulosa, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in whorls around the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
